intro: Tabernaemontana brachypoda, commonly known as the short-stemmed star of Bethlehem, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Apocynaceae family and is characterized by its showy, tubular flowers that bloom in shades of white and pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub with woody stems and lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, making it a popular choice for ornamental gardening. Due to its striking appearance, it is often cultivated for its aesthetic value in gardens and floral arrangements.
